intro: Carex miliaris f. longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-stalked sedge, is a variant of the common sedge species Carex miliaris. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and compact, cylindrical inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, typical of the Cyperaceae family. It thrives in wet or moist environments, such as marshes, pond edges, and damp woodlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various wildlife species.
